definition[0]: a system by which all the people who work for a company receive part of its profits
definition[1]: when a company gives part of its profits to its employees
example[0]: He has long believed in employee profit-sharing or employee ownership.
example[1]: The 2007 profit-sharing payments averaged $650 among full-time employees.
definition[2]: when a MUTUAL (=an insurance company or other financial institution without shareholders) pays out part of its profits to its members
